width.$description: Use when you want to display at the default width for that device screen dimensions.

height.$description: Use when you want to display at the default height for that device screen dimensions.

max-width.$description: Use when you want to display the maximum width for that device screen dimensions.

min-width.$description: Use when you want to display the minimum width for that device screen dimensions.

full-max-width.$description: Use for maximum width of the full container.

full-min-width.$description: Use for minimum width of the full container.

half-max-width.$description: Use for maximum width of the half container.

half-min-width.$description: Use for minimum width of the half container.

one-third-max-width.$description: Use for maximum width of the oneThird container.

one-third-min-width.$description: Use for minimum width of the oneThird container.

two-third-max-width.$description: Use for maximum width of the twoThird container.

two-third-min-width.$description: Use for minimum width of the twoThird container.

one-fourth-max-width.$description: Use for maximum width of the oneFourth container.

one-fourth-min-width.$description: Use for minimum width of the oneFourth container.

center70-max-width.$description: Use to make to establish maxWidth of the centered container, based on device.

margin-x.$description: Used as the base margin on left and right of the container, based on device

margin-y.$description: Used as the base margin on top and bottom of the container, based on device

gutter.$description: Use for the base gutter, based on device

columns.$description: Use for the number of columns in a layout

margin-x.$description: Use to make the container expand full width, based on device

margin-y.$description: Use to make the container expand full height, based on device

gutter.$description: Use for the full width gutter , based on device, based on device

overlap-gutter.$description: Use to control the gutter overlap. (It makes the content overlap each other)

micro.$description: Use for smallest padding, based on device

tight.$description: Use for padding that is TIGHT (between micro and less), based on device

less.$description: Use for padding that is LESS than base (between tight and base), based on device

base.$description: Use for padding that is BASE, also would be considered the middle of the scale. (between more and less), based on device

more.$description: Use for padding that is MORE than base (between base and loose), based on device

loose.$description: Use for padding that is LOOSE (between more and macro), based on device

macro.$description: Use for the largest padding, based on device

micro.$description: Use for smallest margin, based on device

tight.$description: Use for margin that is TIGHT (between micro and less), based on device

less.$description: Use for margin that is LESS than base (between tight and base), based on device

base.$description: Use for margin that is BASE, also would be considered the middle of the scale. (between more and less), based on device

more.$description: Use for margin that is MORE than base (between base and loose), based on device

loose.$description: Use for margin that is LOOSE (between more and macro), based on device

macro.$description: Use for the largest margin, based on device

micro.$description: Use for the smallest space between elements

tight.$description: Use for space between that is TIGHT (between micro and less)

less.$description: Use for space between that is LESS than base (between tight and base)

base.$description: Use for space between that is BASE, also would be considered the middle of the scale. (between more and less)

more.$description: Use for space between that is MORE than base (between base and loose)

loose.$description: Use for space between that is LOOSE (between more and macro)

macro.$description: Use for the largest space between

copy-max-Width.$description: Use to make to establish maxWidth of the text, based on device.

article-rte-max-width.$description: Use to make to establish maxWidth of the text, based on device.
